author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Lebanon, Egypt and Syria hit by sandstorm causing low visibility and flight delay - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Lebanon, Egypt and Syria hit by sandstorm causing low visibility and flight delay Published on : Thursday, September 10, 2015
Atleast 5 people have died as an unprecedented sandstorm swept across the Middle East covering Lebanon and Syria. Airport officials reported some flight delays.
People faced breathing difficulties and were admitted in hospitals as the city was blanketed in yellow sand.
The unseasonal storm hit Jordan, Israel and Egypt. Many schools were shut down or cut shot due to the storm in Jordan.
The storm has reached the Lebanese capital as it completely covered the Bekaa Valley. Those with health issues have been advised to stay indoors and those who have to venture out are advised to use surgical masks. Almost 750 people in Lebanon have suffered breathing problems.
Poor weather has disrupted organised protests that were taking place in the streets for piled up rubbish on Beirutthat that the authorities had warned residents against burning.
More than 1,200 people, including 100 children, had been treated with breathing problems in the Syrian capital, Damascus. Hospitals in the town of al-Mayadeen in the northern province of Deir el-Zour have run out of oxygen cylinders and are unable to take in more patients.
